string_data:
PRIMARY: Three Just Stop Oil activists - Stephen Simpson (71), Mary Somerville (77, retired teacher), and Phillipa Green (24, charity worker) - threw soup at two Van Gogh Sunflowers paintings at the National Gallery on Friday. They targeted the artworks' frames, causing £10,000-£20,000 damage, though the paintings themselves were protected by glass. The action occurred hours after two other Just Stop Oil activists were jailed for a similar 2022 soup attack.

SECONDARY: The primary protest followed the Friday sentencing of Phoebe Plummer (2 years) and Anna Holland (20 months) who threw tomato soup over a Van Gogh Sunflowers painting in October 2022.

OTHER FOCAL: The court proceedings focus on criminal damage charges, with the prosecutor emphasizing the social impact on artworks "loved by millions worldwide."

TONE: The article maintains a neutral, factual tone focused on legal proceedings rather than editorial commentary.
